name: Creamy Garlic Pasta
description: A rich and comforting pasta dish made with garlic, cream, and Parmesan cheese — perfect for weeknights.
directions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant (1–2 minutes).
Pour in cream and bring to a gentle simmer. Stir in Parmesan until melted and smooth.
Season with salt and pepper. Add the cooked pasta and toss to coat.
Serve immediately, topped with chopped parsley.

name: Cold Udon Noodles with Mushrooms and Turnips
description: A hearty and versatile lunch. Put whatever you want on it!
ingredients: 4 oz shiitake or button mushrooms, sliced
directions: Cook udon noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water.
In a skillet, sauté mushrooms over medium heat until golden, about 5 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and grated ginger.
Add cold udon noodles to a serving bowl and top with sautéed mushrooms, julienned turnips, and green onions.
Drizzle the sauce over the noodles and toss to combine.
Garnish with sesame seeds and nori strips. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Chocolate Chip Banana Bread
description: Moist, sweet banana bread loaded with chocolate chips — a cozy classic for any time of day.
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a loaf pan.
In a bowl, mix mashed bananas and melted butter.
Stir in sugar, egg, and vanilla.
Add baking soda, salt, and flour. Mix until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips and pour into loaf pan.
Bake for 50–60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
